newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: San Carlos denies imported sugar pile-up.
newsitem.headline: San Carlos denies imported sugar pile-up.

text.p: Philippine sugar miller San Carlos Milling denied talk on Wednesday it was experiencing financial difficulties due to its huge inventory of imported sugar.
"We have sold our imported sugar last year," an official of the company told Reuters.

Talk of San Carlos' financial troubles hammered shares of Metropolitan Bank and Trust Co (Metrobank) in late Manil a trade. Metrobank was reported to have extended a 1.1 billion peso loan to San Carlos.
"While we have a loan from Metrobank, we are not in default," the San Carlos official said.
The domestic market is experiencing a sugar glut due to an oversupply of imported sugar in recent months.

Another sugar miller, Victorias Milling Corp, recently sought a 90-day moratorium on the principal payment of its 4.423 billion peso debt from 32 foreign and local financial institutions as a result of a downturn in the local sugar industry.
